content: Martin Dvořák has marked this topic as resolved.
Is this the sort of thing that some enterprising programmer in our community could add to the lean extension?
In relation to this: is it possible to collapse tactic-mode proofs in lean4 (no begin-end blocks anymore)?
In lean3, collapsing is done only by indentation (the default in vscode if languages don't specify custom folding)
Lean4 should be able to do better than that, if it doesn't already
maybe it is a just a VSCode setting that I'm not aware of...

I have the following setting which works well

    "[lean4]": {
        "editor.foldingStrategy": "indentation", }
This indeed just indentation based, but seeing as lean 4 is whitespace sensitive this actually makes even more sense as a default than in lean 3!

The PR to add LSP-based support for this is merged I think -- https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/pull/1014 so there should be something even better even than indentation which works in VSCode (and possibly neovim+emacs, I forget if foldingRange exists yet)
I added this setting myself only recently as I wanted to fold have blocks in long proofs, and I couldn't see an option to do that without this setting
Ah I see that subgoals aren't mentioned in that pr, so perhaps that should be a feature request
